basics.name: Andra-Lorena Gradinaru
basics.label: Senior Healthcare Professional & Team Lead
basics.summary: Dedicated Healthcare Professional with over five years of experience in clinical care settings, specializing in elderly care and mental health support. Combines high-level person-centred care with a strong academic background in Business Management and Teaching. Proven track record in supervising multidisciplinary teams, ensuring regulatory compliance (CQC standards), and advocating for resident dignity. Expert in managing complex care plans while maintaining the highest standards of confidentiality and professional ethics.

work.name: Runwood Homes Ltd
work.summary: Delivering specialized personal and mental health support within a high-standard residential environment.
highlights: Execute tailored care interventions for 15+ vulnerable residents, achieving 95% positive resident satisfaction ratings through proactive emotional and physical support strategies.

Facilitate and implement risk assessments and care plan reviews for individuals with complex mental health needs, resulting in a 30% reduction in safeguarding incidents through early intervention protocols.
Uphold rigorous safeguarding protocols and clinical governance standards, maintaining 100% CQC compliance and zero regulatory violations across all audits.

work.name: Abbotsleigh Mews
work.summary: Leadership role focused on operational excellence, staff supervision, and quality assurance.
highlights: Directed daily operations and supervised a team of 8-10 care assistants across multiple shifts, consistently maintaining high service standards and achieving 92% staff retention rates through effective mentorship.

Conducted monthly quality audits and 'spot checks' across facility operations, identifying and resolving 40+ compliance gaps annually and maintaining full adherence to health and social care regulations with zero CQC infractions.
Championed person-centred care initiatives that enhanced resident independence and quality of life, improving resident mobility scores by 25% and increasing participation in social activities by 35%.

work.name: Bupa Care Services
work.summary: Coordinated resident care and administrative documentation within a leading private healthcare provider.
highlights: Managed comprehensive care records and conducted quarterly service user reviews for 20+ residents, ensuring 100% documentation accuracy and timely identification of evolving care needs.
Mentored 5-7 junior staff members on clinical protocols, professional conduct, and efficient personal care delivery, resulting in a 40% improvement in new staff competency assessments.
Liaised with families and multidisciplinary medical professionals to coordinate holistic care strategies, achieving 98% family satisfaction with care communication and coordination.
